textBeforeTable: Patent Citations UNITED STATES PATENTS Number Name Date 259,091 Burrett June 6, 1882 1,401,462 Circle Dec. 27, 1921 1,457,895 Campanella June 5, 1923 1,650,081 Lindsay Nov. 22, 1927 2,138,133 Betzler Nov. 29, 1938 2,183,561 Hamblin Dec. 19, 1939 2,210,846 Aghnides AugQG, 1940 2,213,955 De Freitas Sept. 10, 1940 2,316,832 Aghnides Apr. 20, 1943 2,375,833 Urquhart May 15, 1945 FOREIGN PATENTS Number Country Date 441,441 Great Britain Jan. 20, 1936 468,687 Great Britain July 6, 1937 REFERENCES CITED The following references are of record in the file of this patent: STANLEY ALFRED HAYES. In an irrigator head the combination comprisconduit being flared at one end and connected at l the flared end to the open end of the outlet member, means at the other end of the conduit for connection to a source of water under pressure, a reduced diameter throat in the conduit adjacent said other end, a plurality of ports in the conduit Wall adjacent the throat and on the downstream Side of the throat, and a plurality of layers of packing arranged in diverse directions in the outlet member and substantially filling the outlet member, the packing being arranged to permit discharge of uid entering the head in several directions through the plurality of perforations and so freely as not to destroy suction in said plurality of ports. I claim: The invention makes possible the thorough watering of delicate plants
